result.execSummary:
The defendant Damariyah M Muhammad was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Damariyah M Muhammad is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Damariyah M Muhammad was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:14 PM Hearing held via Zoom due to Judge illness- parties agree to proceed. Defendant Damariyah M Muhammad in court.  Attorney Reed Cornia in court for Damariyah M Muhammad.  Attorney Lillian Nelson for Rebekah M Rennicke in court for State of Wisconsin. PSI Writer Melissa Davis by phone. 


Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT # 1  
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 1 years cc to 19CF2813 and 20CF2983

CONDITIONS:
-Maintain full-time employment/education or a combination of both or be seeking same and treatment
-No contact with: T.D.D. or D.D.G. 
-DNA on file
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct #1
-DA surcharge
-All CC due w/in 60 days. DNA surcharge waived. 

-Bond posted to be applied to fines and cc only and remainder returned to poster.

-Days credit for time already served: 3 days
-Days credit if revoked: 3 days

DE advised of post-conviction rights

A. Martinelli
